subject: p15438386
History: Small-bowel obstruction, status post nasogastric tube placement. Evaluate tube position.
Findings: A new enteric catheter ends either at the gastric antrum or first portion of the duodenum. Lung volumes are low, causing exaggeration of the heart size and accentuation of the pulmonary vasculature. The lungs are clear. The heart size is normal. The descending thoracic aorta is slightly tortuous. There are no pleural effusions. No pneumothorax is seen.
Impression: No acute cardiac or pulmonary process. New enteric catheter ends either in the gastric antrum or first portion of the duodenum.
